Bio Music Video

Born in Nashville, TN to his mother, the former manager of “Take 6”, Gail Masondo, and his father, Duane Hamilton, a singer with the local group, “The Brothers Of Nashville”, Ziyon (born Jonathan Hamilton) developed a deep love for music at an early age. From the age of nine, he would join his mother in studio sessions and watch closely as songs were being crafted. This childhood experience helped to shape his musical journey and as a teenager he was already writing his own music and performing at various events in his home town.

When he left high-school, he decided to pursue music full time. He was involved in an improv hip-hop band called “Audiofonix” during his early twenties and they played at various venues in Nashville, gaining experience and having fun.

In 2004 he decided to move to Johannesburg to be with his mother and her husband, producer/bassist Victor Masondo, and really began focusing on building his professional career. He enjoyed writing and producing for other artists and became very intrigued with the local deep house scene.

In 2006, Ziyon met dj/producer Ryzor, eventually forming the group, “Liquideep”. Four years later, in 2010, they would release their award winning album “Fabrics Of The Heart” and began touring the world. After four years together, in 2014, the group parted ways and Ziyon began his solo career, releasing his debut album, “Audio Alchemy”.

Known for his soulful voice and thoughtful lyrics, he immediately gathered a loyal fan base around him. His style of music is not just limited to deep house but is also influenced by hip hop, soul, gospel and electronic music. This melodic mix creates a distinctive sound that intrigues and transports his listeners. He seems larger than life when performing his music, penetrating into hearts and souls of those who listen.

Since the release of Ziyon’s current album, “ALGRTHMS”, his career has come a long way. With the heavy use of chopped up samples, driving rhythms and a solid low end, Ziyon fully showcases his ability to create an atmosphere through sound. During the 2020 pandemic, he founded the record label, Nirvatone, and began releasing content via the imprint.

Writing and recording his latest upcoming release has been a priority and Ziyon hopes to release it within the year. He says that this project is a culmination of many years of experience and offers a new atmosphere for listeners whilst retaining all the well-loved elements of his past releases.
